overview: Students enrol in Empirical Investments after the completion of Empirical Corporate Finance, these subjects are completed in two consecutive semesters. A number of seminars will be held during the semester to discuss various aspects of the program including bibliographic and other resources available to students and a range of analytical and empirical research methods and techniques used in Finance. Among other things, the workshops provide a forum for students to discuss and develop their own research proposals, and to develop seminar and conference presentation ability.

additional pre-requisite: Admission into the MC-COMFIN Master of Commerce (Finance)

assessments.description: Individual in-class presentation and discussion leading of required readings.. 20 minutes
Individual in-class presentation of seminar papers.. 20 minutes
Assignment, covering material taught in lectures 1 through 5 inclusive.. 1000 words
Assignment, covering material taught in lectures 7 through 11 inclusive.. 1000 words
Examination, covering material taught in lectures 1 through 12 inclusive.. 2 hours

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.

Related Handbook entries: This subject contributes to the following:
Available to Study Abroad and/or Study E: This subject is available to students studying at the University from eligible overseas institutions on exchange and study abroad. Students are required to satisfy any listed requirements, such as pre- and co-requisites, for enrolment in the subject.
